definition: to flourish then decline/rise and fall
to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil
to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble
life has its ups and downs (idiom)

sentences.english: The imperial examination system's rise and fall, was closely related with our culture.
sentences.chinese: 科举制度的盛衰，与我国文化传统密切相关。

sentences.english: So do the dual forces of the Tao wax and wane in the alternation of upward and downward cycles, intercrossing.
sentences.chinese: 在升降的交替中，道的盛衰盈亏两个力量也是如此。

sentences.english: Strengthening the construction of leading groups is directly related to the prosperity and decline of the Party and the nation.
sentences.chinese: 加强领导班子建设，直接关系到党和国家的盛衰兴亡。

sentences.english: The problem of talents is very important to a country' s prosperity and decline, or ups and downs.
sentences.chinese: 人才问题是关系到一个国家的盛衰和兴亡的重大问题。

sentences.english: This is a state and national well-being of ups and downs of life and death choices.
sentences.chinese: 这是关系国家盛衰和国民福祉的生死选择。

sentences.english: The heavens change every moment, and reflect their glory or gloom on the plains beneath.
sentences.chinese: 天空变幻无穷，映呈着下界的盛衰枯荣。

sentences.english: Education is the lifeblood of the country.
sentences.chinese: 教育事业的成败关乎国脉的盛衰。

sentences.english: Sex, like everything else in life, has its ebbs and flows.
sentences.chinese: 性爱，和生活的任何其他事情一样，也有它的盛衰。

sentences.english: In a long life I have had many ups and downs .
sentences.chinese: 在我漫长的一生中，经过许多盛衰荣辱。

sentences.english: Schumpeter had a rise - and -fall mechanism in mind.
sentences.chinese: 熊彼特头脑中有一个兴盛衰废的机制。
这就是商业盛衰的循环。

sentences.english: The sun's activity waxes and wanes on an 11-year cycle.
sentences.chinese: 太阳活动的盛衰以11年为一个周期。

sentences.english: The ups and downs of the rival parties furnished subjects for two excellent cartoons.
sentences.chinese: 敌对两党之盛衰给两幅最优秀的漫画提供了题材。

sentences.english: The rise and fall of Wuhu rice market was closely connected with the establishment and abolition of the tax system.
sentences.chinese: 芜湖米市的盛衰，与厘金制度的设废有着密切的关联。

definition: prosperity and decline (of a kingdom)/rise and fall
to ebb and rise/to decrease and then grow
to flourish and decay/rise and fall
to take over (from one another)/to alternate/to replace/to relay
to share the same interests (idiom)/to be closely related/to be in the same boat
World Games/abbr. for 世界運動會|世界运动会[Shi4 jie4 Yun4 dong4 hui4]
to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble
